sentinel.led
Class TimeItem

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--sentinel.led.TimeItem
class TimeItem
extends java.lang.Object

The TimeItem class is used to store a time value appearing in an absolute or a relative temporal event. It contains methods to parse the absolute and relative time strings and convert them into their numerical equivalent in milliseconds. The times supported are to the precision of seconds. For absolute time strings with wild cards (?,*), the time item has to be updated for each value of the wild card field. The TimeItem class also contains data structures and methods to accomodate the updates to be made to absolute time strings. Relative time strings cannot be specified with wild cards.

LOWER_LIMIT

QUEST_LIMIT

static int[] QUEST_LIMIT
The values in these fields are used to roll over for wildcards like ?3 These values represent the highest limit values taken by the left most wild cards.

GRANULARITY

static int GRANULARITY
The lowest increment value for the seconds unit.

myLimits

int[] myLimits
This array stores the upper limits for each time field

increments

int[] increments
This array stores the increment values for each time field. For example, if a particular time field is ?2, the increment value is 10. For 1?, increment is 1, and for *, the increment is 1. For 30, the increment value is zero.

updatesFinished

boolean[] updatesFinished
This array stores the information if a particular time field needs any more updates or not. Fields with wild cards need updates whereas fields with no wild cards do not need updates.

questFieldLimit

int[] questFieldLimit
This array stores the question field limit for all fields. For example, if the days field contains ?1, the quest field limit for it would be 3 since there can only be 31 days possible and the value 41 for a day is invalid.

timeField

int[] timeField
This array stores the value of all the time fields in integers. Each of the time fields specified in the time string are converted into their equivalent integers in order to increment them with updated values.

STAR

static final char STAR

QUEST

static final char QUEST

NIL

static final char NIL

updatesRequired

boolean updatesRequired
This variable stores if this time item requires any more updates or not.

zoneOffset

static long zoneOffset
This variable stores the offset value to be subtracted for relative temporal events. This value is determined by the time zone where the program is run. It is calculated by getting a Calendar instance and its ZONE_OFFSET and DST_OFFSET (day-light savings time) values.

Method Detail 

static void ()
The SimpleDateFormat objects for absolute and relative time strings. These objects are used to parse the time strings to obtain their equivalent value in milliseconds since Jan 1, 1970.

convertUnit

int convertUnit(java.lang.String fieldStr,
                int fieldPos)
This method takes a particular field string and if there are wild cards in that field, it substitutes the wild card with its lowest possible value.

getCurrentYear

int getCurrentYear()
This method returns the current year. If a wild card is specified in the year field, it is substituted with the current year value and not 0.

setQuestFieldLimits

void setQuestFieldLimits(int fieldPos)
The limits for the wild card fields are set depending on the values in other fields. For example, if the month is feb, the number of days would be 28 and the number of days would be different for other months.

daysInMonth

int daysInMonth(int month)
This method returns the number of days in the given month.

boolean isLeapYear(int year)
The method returns true if the given year is a leap year.

All the integer time fields in the timeField[] array are converted to strings and the string is parsed to get the corresponding date object.

updateUnit

boolean updateUnit(int fieldPos)
This method updates a particular field of the time string.

highestWildCardPos

int highestWildCardPos()
This method returns the highest field that contains a wild card. The wild cards are first substituted for the seconds, and then in the order of minutes, hours, days, months and years.

lastUpdate

boolean lastUpdate()
This method returns the field for which the last update has been done.
